newsitem.title: GERMANY: Eurowings adds Air France, KLM cooperation flights.
newsitem.headline: Eurowings adds Air France, KLM cooperation flights.

text.p: German airline Eurowings Luftverkehrs AG said it has increased cooperation flights from Germany with partners Air France and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.
The German carrier has added a third Dortmund to Paris weekday flight, on which Air France has a fixed seat contingent.
Eurowings said it also now offered seats on the three times a day Air France Express BAe146 jet flights from Cologne to Paris.

A spokeswoman said the airline has added a fourth daily Hanover to Amsterdam flight and has increased seat capacity 80 percent on the most popular flights by upgrading from an ATR-42 to an ATR-72 aircraft.
- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
